content: this legal case involves two parties and started in the municipal court of vukovar in april 2020 it then moved to the county court of vukovar in may 2021 the case lasted for 4 years and cost 644000 croatian kunas the final resolution was the dissolution of coownership of an agricultural land through geometric division the petitioner received one part of the land while the counter parties received specific shares the decision was based on the property act initially the counter parties requested compensation but the court later accepted the petitioners proposal for geometric division an expert determined the new cadastral parcels based on coownership ratios the court followed the provisions of the property act and carried out the dissolution accordingly the experts findings were used to determine the division of the property using geometric division as required by the property act the property was located outside a construction zone and within an agricultural area with access to public transport the regulations outlined in the geodetic elaborates were followed for the geometric division
